item.title: Richard add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "It is a bit embarrassing to have been concerned with the human problem all one's life and find at the end that one has no more to offer by way of advice than 'Try to be a little kinder." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Richard add a quote by thomas jefferson
item.description: "There is not a sprig of grass that shoots uninteresting to me." -- thomas jefferson

item.title: Richard add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "You are the Truth from foot to brow. Now, what else would you like to know?" -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Richard add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "The savage in man is never quite eradicated." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Richard add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Richard add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one." -- John Lennon

item.title: Richard add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Richard add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Richard add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "There is no remedy for love, but to love more." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Richard add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "My greatest skill in life has been to want but little" -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Richard add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Richard add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Richard add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Richard add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "If a thing loves, it is infinite." -- William Blake

item.title: Richard add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I like sometimes to take rank hold on life and spend my day more as the animals do." -- Henry David Thoreau
